page.title: 05University of St. Andrews
page.content: {The Univesity of St. Andrews}was founded in 1410.The first building was in South Street.{St. Salvator's {College}was founded in 1450,{ {St.Leonard's College}in 1512 and{St. {Mary's College}in 1537.In the gardens of St. Mary's College there is a tree which is said to have been planted by Mary Queen of Scots.The university was the principal seat of learning in Scotland for over 200 years until, in the 18th. century, there was a decline in the population of town and university. People from all over Britain come to St. Andrews to study as do many foreign students. There are between 3500 and 4000 students in the university at present. The buildings and Student Residences are situated all over the town.
